byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Baghdad, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington. Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Agreement between United States and Turkey to enhance collaboration in fight against Islamic State group in northern Syria is major step toward battling militant group; carrying out agreement presents numerous complications, particularly in way it deepens US involvement in fight and also marginalizes Syrian Kurdish YPG militias, which Turkey considers enemies.
lead_paragraph: The two countries will clear the Islamic State forces out of a 60-mile-long strip along the Turkish border, a major step toward increasing pressure on the militant group.

headline.main: Goals Diverge and Perils Remain as U.S. and Turkey Take on ISIS
headline.print_headline: Goals Diverge and Perils Remain as U.S. and Turkey Take On ISIS

snippet: The two countries will clear the Islamic State forces out of a 60-mile-long strip along the Turkish border, a major step toward increasing pressure on the militant group.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
